duration.description: Duration is the duration in nanoseconds

factor.description: Duration is multiplied by factor each iteration

jitter.description: The amount of jitter applied each iteration

steps.description: Exit with error after this many steps

io.argoproj.common.Condition.description: Condition contains details about resource state

lastTransitionTime.description: Last time the condition transitioned from one status to another.

message.description: Human-readable message indicating details about last transition.

reason.description: Unique, this should be a short, machine understandable string that gives the reason for condition's last transition. For example, "ImageNotFound"

status.description: Condition status, True, False or Unknown.

io.argoproj.common.S3Artifact.description: S3Artifact contains information about an S3 connection and bucket

io.argoproj.common.S3Bucket.description: S3Bucket contains information to describe an S3 Bucket

io.argoproj.common.S3Filter.description: S3Filter represents filters to apply to bucket nofifications for specifying constraints on objects

io.argoproj.common.Status.description: Status is a common structure which can be used for Status field.

conditions.description: Conditions are the latest available observations of a resource's current state.

io.argoproj.eventbus.v1alpha1.BusConfig.description: BusConfig has the finalized configuration for EventBus

io.argoproj.eventbus.v1alpha1.ContainerT.description: ContainerTemplate defines customized spec for a container

io.argoproj.eventbus.v1alpha1.EventBus.description: EventBus is the definition of a eventbus resource

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

io.argoproj.eventbus.v1alpha1.EventBusLi.description: EventBusList is the list of eventbus resources

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

io.argoproj.eventbus.v1alpha1.EventBusSp.description: EventBusSpec refers to specification of eventbus resource

io.argoproj.eventbus.v1alpha1.EventBusSt.description: EventBusStatus holds the status of the eventbus resource

conditions.description: Conditions are the latest available observations of a resource's current state.

config.description: Config holds the fininalized configuration of EventBus

io.argoproj.eventbus.v1alpha1.NATSBus.description: NATSBus holds the NATS eventbus information

exotic.description: Exotic holds an exotic NATS config

native.description: Native means to bring up a native NATS service

io.argoproj.eventbus.v1alpha1.NATSConfig.description: NATSConfig holds the config of NATS

clusterID.description: Cluster ID for nats streaming, if it's missing, treat it as NATS server

io.argoproj.eventbus.v1alpha1.NativeStra.description: NativeStrategy indicates to install a native NATS service

containerTemplate.description: ContainerTemplate contains customized spec for NATS container

metricsContainerTemplate.description: MetricsContainerTemplate contains customized spec for metrics container

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector is a selector which must be true for the pod to fit on a node. Selector which must match a node's labels for the pod to be scheduled on that node. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/assign-pod-node/

replicas.description: Size is the NATS StatefulSet size

io.argoproj.eventbus.v1alpha1.Persistenc.description: PersistenceStrategy defines the strategy of persistence

accessMode.description: Available access modes such as ReadWriteOnce, ReadWriteMany https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes/#access-modes

storageClassName.description: Name of the StorageClass required by the claim. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#class-1

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.AMQPEve.description: AMQPEventSource refers to an event-source for AMQP stream events

connectionBackoff.description: Backoff holds parameters applied to connection.

exchangeName.description: ExchangeName is the exchange name For more information, visit https://www.rabbitmq.com/tutorials/amqp-concepts.html

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

tls.description: TLS configuration for the amqp client.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.AzureEv.description: AzureEventsHubEventSource describes the event source for azure events hub More info at https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/event-hubs/

fqdn.description: FQDN of the EventHubs namespace you created More info at https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/event-hubs/event-hubs-get-connection-string

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

sharedAccessKey.description: SharedAccessKey is the the generated value of the key

sharedAccessKeyName.description: SharedAccessKeyName is the name you chose for your application's SAS keys

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Calenda.description: CalendarEventSource describes a time based dependency. One of the fields (schedule, interval, or recurrence) must be passed. Schedule takes precedence over interval; interval takes precedence over recurrence

interval.description: Interval is a string that describes an interval duration, e.g. 1s, 30m, 2h...

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

schedule.description: Schedule is a cron-like expression. For reference, see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cron

timezone.description: Timezone in which to run the schedule

userPayload.description: UserPayload will be sent to sensor as extra data once the event is triggered Deprecated. Please use Metadata instead.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Emitter.description: EmitterEventSource describes the event source for emitter More info at https://emitter.io/develop/getting-started/

channelKey.description: ChannelKey refers to the channel key

channelName.description: ChannelName refers to the channel name

connectionBackoff.description: Backoff holds parameters applied to connection.

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

password.description: Password to use to connect to broker

tls.description: TLS configuration for the emitter client.

username.description: Username to use to connect to broker

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.EventSo.description: EventSource is the definition of a eventsource resource

More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.EventSo.description: EventSourceSpec refers to specification of event-source resource

eventBusName.description: EventBusName references to a EventBus name. By default the value is "default"

replica.description: Replica is the gateway deployment replicas

service.description: Service is the specifications of the service to expose the event source

template.description: Template is the pod specification for the event source

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.EventSo.description: EventSourceStatus holds the status of the event-source resource

conditions.description: Conditions are the latest available observations of a resource's current state.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.FileEve.description: FileEventSource describes an event-source for file related events.

eventType.description: Type of file operations to watch Refer https://github.com/fsnotify/fsnotify/blob/master/fsnotify.go for more information

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

watchPathConfig.description: WatchPathConfig contains configuration about the file path to watch

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Generic.description: GenericEventSource refers to a generic event source. It can be used to implement a custom event source.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.GithubE.description: GithubEventSource refers to event-source for github related events

active.description: Active refers to status of the webhook for event deliveries. https://developer.github.com/webhooks/creating/#active

apiToken.description: APIToken refers to a K8s secret containing github api token

deleteHookOnFinish.description: DeleteHookOnFinish determines whether to delete the GitHub hook for the repository once the event source is stopped.

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

owner.description: Owner refers to GitHub owner name i.e. argoproj

repository.description: Repository refers to GitHub repo name i.e. argo-events

webhook.description: Webhook refers to the configuration required to run a http server

webhookSecret.description: WebhookSecret refers to K8s secret containing GitHub webhook secret https://developer.github.com/webhooks/securing/

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.GitlabE.description: GitlabEventSource refers to event-source related to Gitlab events

accessToken.description: AccessToken is reference to k8 secret which holds the gitlab api access information

deleteHookOnFinish.description: DeleteHookOnFinish determines whether to delete the GitLab hook for the project once the event source is stopped.

events.description: Events are gitlab event to listen to. Refer https://github.com/xanzy/go-gitlab/blob/bf34eca5d13a9f4c3f501d8a97b8ac226d55e4d9/projects.go#L794.

gitlabBaseURL.description: GitlabBaseURL is the base URL for API requests to a custom endpoint

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

projectID.description: ProjectID is the id of project for which integration needs to setup

webhook.description: Webhook holds configuration to run a http server

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.HDFSEve.description: HDFSEventSource refers to event-source for HDFS related events

checkInterval.description: CheckInterval is a string that describes an interval duration to check the directory state, e.g. 1s, 30m, 2h... (defaults to 1m)

hdfsUser.description: HDFSUser is the user to access HDFS file system. It is ignored if either ccache or keytab is used.

krbCCacheSecret.description: KrbCCacheSecret is the secret selector for Kerberos ccache Either ccache or keytab can be set to use Kerberos.

krbConfigConfigMap.description: KrbConfig is the configmap selector for Kerberos config as string It must be set if either ccache or keytab is used.

krbKeytabSecret.description: KrbKeytabSecret is the secret selector for Kerberos keytab Either ccache or keytab can be set to use Kerberos.

krbRealm.description: KrbRealm is the Kerberos realm used with Kerberos keytab It must be set if keytab is used.

krbServicePrincipalName.description: KrbServicePrincipalName is the principal name of Kerberos service It must be set if either ccache or keytab is used.

krbUsername.description: KrbUsername is the Kerberos username used with Kerberos keytab It must be set if keytab is used.

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

path.description: Path is relative path of object to watch with respect to the directory

pathRegexp.description: PathRegexp is regexp of relative path of object to watch with respect to the directory

type.description: Type of file operations to watch

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.KafkaEv.description: KafkaEventSource refers to event-source for Kafka related events

connectionBackoff.description: Backoff holds parameters applied to connection.

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

tls.description: TLS configuration for the kafka client.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.MQTTEve.description: MQTTEventSource refers to event-source for MQTT related events

clientId.description: ClientID is the id of the client

connectionBackoff.description: ConnectionBackoff holds backoff applied to connection.

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

tls.description: TLS configuration for the mqtt client.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Metadat.description: Metadata holds the annotations and labels of an event source pod

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.NATSEve.description: NATSEventsSource refers to event-source for NATS related events

connectionBackoff.description: ConnectionBackoff holds backoff applied to connection.

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

subject.description: Subject holds the name of the subject onto which messages are published

tls.description: TLS configuration for the nats client.

url.description: URL to connect to NATS cluster

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.NSQEven.description: NSQEventSource describes the event source for NSQ PubSub More info at https://godoc.org/github.com/nsqio/go-nsq

connectionBackoff.description: Backoff holds parameters applied to connection.

hostAddress.description: HostAddress is the address of the host for NSQ lookup

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

tls.description: TLS configuration for the nsq client.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.PubSubE.description: PubSubEventSource refers to event-source for GCP PubSub related events.

credentialSecret.description: CredentialSecret references to the secret that contains JSON credentials to access GCP. If it is missing, it implicts to use Workload Identity to access. https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/how-to/workload-identity

credentialsFile.description: CredentialsFile is the file that contains credentials to authenticate for GCP

deleteSubscriptionOnFinish.description: DeleteSubscriptionOnFinish determines whether to delete the GCP PubSub subscription once the event source is stopped.

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

projectID.description: ProjectID is the unique identifier for your project on GCP

subscriptionID.description: SubscriptionID is given then use it instead of creating a new one

topic.description: Topic on which a subscription will be created

topicProjectID.description: TopicProjectID identifies the project where the topic should exist or be created (assumed to be the same as ProjectID by default)

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.PulsarE.description: PulsarEventSource describes the event source for Apache Pulsar

connectionBackoff.description: Backoff holds parameters applied to connection.

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

tls.description: TLS configuration for the pulsar client.

tlsAllowInsecureConnection.description: Whether the Pulsar client accept untrusted TLS certificate from broker.

tlsTrustCertsFilePath.description: Set the path to the trusted TLS certificate file.

tlsValidateHostname.description: Whether the Pulsar client verify the validity of the host name from broker.

topics.description: Name of the topics to subscribe to.

type.description: Type of the subscription. Only "exclusive" and "shared" is supported. Defaults to exclusive.

url.description: Configure the service URL for the Pulsar service.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.RedisEv.description: RedisEventSource describes an event source for the Redis PubSub. More info at https://godoc.org/github.com/go-redis/redis#example-PubSub

db.description: DB to use. If not specified, default DB 0 will be used.

hostAddress.description: HostAddress refers to the address of the Redis host/server

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

namespace.description: Namespace to use to retrieve the password from. It should only be specified if password is declared

password.description: Password required for authentication if any.

tls.description: TLS configuration for the redis client.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Resourc.description: ResourceEventSource refers to a event-source for K8s resource related events.

eventTypes.description: EventTypes is the list of event type to watch. Possible values are - ADD, UPDATE and DELETE.

filter.description: Filter is applied on the metadata of the resource If you apply filter, then the internal event informer will only monitor objects that pass the filter.

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Resourc.description: ResourceFilter contains K8 ObjectMeta information to further filter resource event objects

afterStart.description: If the resource is created after the start time then the event is treated as valid.

createdBy.description: If resource is created before the specified time then the event is treated as valid.

fields.description: Fields provide listing options to K8s API to watch resource/s. Refer https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/field-selectors/ for more info.

labels.description: Labels provide listing options to K8s API to watch resource/s. Refer https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/label-selectors/ for more info.

prefix.description: Prefix filter is applied on the resource name.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.SNSEven.description: SNSEventSource refers to event-source for AWS SNS related events

accessKey.description: AccessKey refers K8 secret containing aws access key

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

roleARN.description: RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume.

secretKey.description: SecretKey refers K8 secret containing aws secret key

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.SQSEven.description: SQSEventSource refers to event-source for AWS SQS related events

accessKey.description: AccessKey refers K8 secret containing aws access key

jsonBody.description: JSONBody specifies that all event body payload coming from this source will be JSON

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

queue.description: Queue is AWS SQS queue to listen to for messages

queueAccountId.description: QueueAccountID is the ID of the account that created the queue to monitor

roleARN.description: RoleARN is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume.

secretKey.description: SecretKey refers K8 secret containing aws secret key

waitTimeSeconds.description: WaitTimeSeconds is The duration (in seconds) for which the call waits for a message to arrive in the queue before returning.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Selecto.description: Selector represents conditional operation to select K8s objects.

operation.description: Supported operations like ==, !=, <=, >= etc. Defaults to ==. Refer https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#label-selectors for more info.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Service.description: Service holds the service information eventsource exposes

clusterIP.description: clusterIP is the IP address of the service and is usually assigned randomly by the master. If an address is specified manually and is not in use by others, it will be allocated to the service; otherwise, creation of the service will fail. This field can not be changed through updates. Valid values are "None", empty string (""), or a valid IP address. "None" can be specified for headless services when proxying is not required. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#virtual-ips-and-service-proxies

ports.description: The list of ports that are exposed by this ClusterIP service.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.SlackEv.description: SlackEventSource refers to event-source for Slack related events

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

webhook.description: Webhook holds configuration for a REST endpoint

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Storage.description: StorageGridEventSource refers to event-source for StorageGrid related events

apiURL.description: APIURL is the url of the storagegrid api.

bucket.description: Name of the bucket to register notifications for.

filter.description: Filter on object key which caused the notification.

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

webhook.description: Webhook holds configuration for a REST endpoint

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Storage.description: StorageGridFilter represents filters to apply to bucket notifications for specifying constraints on objects

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.StripeE.description: StripeEventSource describes the event source for stripe webhook notifications More info at https://stripe.com/docs/webhooks

apiKey.description: APIKey refers to K8s secret that holds Stripe API key. Used only if CreateWebhook is enabled.

createWebhook.description: CreateWebhook if specified creates a new webhook programmatically.

eventFilter.description: EventFilter describes the type of events to listen to. If not specified, all types of events will be processed. More info at https://stripe.com/docs/api/events/list

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

webhook.description: Webhook holds configuration for a REST endpoint

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.TLSConf.description: TLSConfig refers to TLS configuration for a client.

caCertPath.description: CACertPath refers the file path that contains the CA cert.

clientCertPath.description: ClientCertPath refers the file path that contains client cert.

clientKeyPath.description: ClientKeyPath refers the file path that contains client key.

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Templat.description: Template holds the information of an EventSource deployment template

affinity.description: If specified, the pod's scheduling constraints

container.description: Container is the main container image to run in the event source pod

metadata.description: Metdata sets the pods's metadata, i.e. annotations and labels

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector is a selector which must be true for the pod to fit on a node. Selector which must match a node's labels for the pod to be scheduled on that node. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/assign-pod-node/

securityContext.description: SecurityContext holds pod-level security attributes and common container settings. Optional: Defaults to empty.  See type description for default values of each field.

serviceAccountName.description: ServiceAccountName is the name of the ServiceAccount to use to run event source pod. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/configure-service-account/

volumes.description: Volumes is a list of volumes that can be mounted by containers in a workflow.

path.description: Path is relative path of object to watch with respect to the directory

pathRegexp.description: PathRegexp is regexp of relative path of object to watch with respect to the directory

io.argoproj.eventsource.v1alpha1.Webhook.description: WebhookContext holds a general purpose REST API context

metadata.description: Metadata holds the user defined metadata which will passed along the event payload.

method.description: Method is HTTP request method that indicates the desired action to be performed for a given resource. See RFC7231 Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1): Semantics and Content

port.description: Port on which HTTP server is listening for incoming events.

serverCertPath.description: ServerCertPath refers the file that contains the cert.

serverKeyPath.description: ServerKeyPath refers the file that contains private key

url.description: URL is the url of the server.

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.AWSLambdaTri.description: AWSLambdaTrigger refers to specification of the trigger to invoke an AWS Lambda function

accessKey.description: AccessKey refers K8 secret containing aws access key

functionName.description: FunctionName refers to the name of the function to invoke.

secretKey.description: SecretKey refers K8 secret containing aws secret key

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.ArgoWorkflow.description: ArgoWorkflowTrigger is the trigger for the Argo Workflow

operation.description: Operation refers to the type of operation performed on the argo workflow resource. Default value is Submit.

source.description: Source of the K8 resource file(s)

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.ArtifactLoca.description: ArtifactLocation describes the source location for an external artifact

file.description: File artifact is artifact stored in a file

inline.description: Inline artifact is embedded in sensor spec as a string

resource.description: Resource is generic template for K8s resource

url.description: URL to fetch the artifact from

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.BasicAuth.description: BasicAuth contains the reference to K8s secrets that holds the username and password

password.description: Password refers to the Kubernetes secret that holds the password required for basic auth.

username.description: Username refers to the Kubernetes secret that holds the username required for basic auth.

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.CustomTrigge.description: CustomTrigger refers to the specification of the custom trigger.

certFilePath.description: CertFilePath is path to the cert file within sensor for secure connection between sensor and custom trigger gRPC server.

secure.description: Secure refers to type of the connection between sensor to custom trigger gRPC

serverNameOverride.description: ServerNameOverride for the secure connection between sensor and custom trigger gRPC server.

serverURL.description: ServerURL is the url of the gRPC server that executes custom trigger

spec.description: Spec is the custom trigger resource specification that custom trigger gRPC server knows how to interpret.

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.DataFilter.description: DataFilter describes constraints and filters for event data Regular Expressions are purposefully not a feature as they are overkill for our uses here See Rob Pike's Post: https://commandcenter.blogspot.com/2011/08/regular-expressions-in-lexing-and.html

comparator.description: Comparator compares the event data with a user given value. Can be ">=", ">", "=", "<", or "<=". Is optional, and if left blank treated as equality "=".

path.description: Path is the JSONPath of the event's (JSON decoded) data key Path is a series of keys separated by a dot. A key may contain wildcard characters '*' and '?'. To access an array value use the index as the key. The dot and wildcard characters can be escaped with '\'. See https://github.com/tidwall/gjson#path-syntax for more information on how to use this.

type.description: Type contains the JSON type of the data

value.description: Value is the allowed string values for this key Booleans are passed using strconv.ParseBool() Numbers are parsed using as float64 using strconv.ParseFloat() Strings are taken as is Nils this value is ignored

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.DependencyGr.description: DependencyGroup is the group of dependencies

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.Event.description: Event represents the cloudevent received from a gateway.

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.EventContext.description: EventContext holds the context of the cloudevent received from a gateway.

datacontenttype.description: DataContentType - A MIME (RFC2046) string describing the media type of `data`.

id.description: ID of the event; must be non-empty and unique within the scope of the producer.

source.description: Source - A URI describing the event producer.

specversion.description: SpecVersion - The version of the CloudEvents specification used by the event.

subject.description: Subject - The subject of the event in the context of the event producer

time.description: Time - A Timestamp when the event happened.

type.description: Type - The type of the occurrence which has happened.

eventName.description: EventName is the name of the event

eventSourceName.description: EventSourceName is the name of EventSource that Sensor depends on

filters.description: Filters and rules governing toleration of success and constraints on the context and data of an event

name.description: Name is a unique name of this dependency

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.EventDepende.description: EventDependencyFilter defines filters and constraints for a event.

name.description: Name is the name of event filter

time.description: Time filter on the event with escalation

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.FileArtifact.description: FileArtifact contains information about an artifact in a filesystem

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.GitArtifact.description: GitArtifact contains information about an artifact stored in git

branch.description: Branch to use to pull trigger resource

cloneDirectory.description: Directory to clone the repository. We clone complete directory because GitArtifact is not limited to any specific Git service providers. Hence we don't use any specific git provider client.

creds.description: Creds contain reference to git username and password

filePath.description: Path to file that contains trigger resource definition

ref.description: Ref to use to pull trigger resource. Will result in a shallow clone and fetch.

remote.description: Remote to manage set of tracked repositories. Defaults to "origin". Refer https://git-scm.com/docs/git-remote

sshKeyPath.description: SSHKeyPath is path to your ssh key path. Use this if you don't want to provide username and password. ssh key path must be mounted in sensor pod.

tag.description: Tag to use to pull trigger resource

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.GitCreds.description: GitCreds contain reference to git username and password

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.GitRemoteCon.description: GitRemoteConfig contains the configuration of a Git remote

name.description: Name of the remote to fetch from.

urls.description: URLs the URLs of a remote repository. It must be non-empty. Fetch will always use the first URL, while push will use all of them.

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.HTTPTrigger.description: HTTPTrigger is the trigger for the HTTP request

basicAuth.description: BasicAuth configuration for the http request.

method.description: Method refers to the type of the HTTP request. Refer https://golang.org/src/net/http/method.go for more info. Default value is POST.

timeout.description: Timeout refers to the HTTP request timeout in seconds. Default value is 60 seconds.

tls.description: TLS configuration for the HTTP client.

url.description: URL refers to the URL to send HTTP request to.

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.K8SResourceP.description: K8SResourcePolicy refers to the policy used to check the state of K8s based triggers using labels

errorOnBackoffTimeout.description: ErrorOnBackoffTimeout determines whether sensor should transition to error state if the trigger policy is unable to determine the state of the resource

labels.description: Labels required to identify whether a resource is in success state

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.KafkaTrigger.description: KafkaTrigger refers to the specification of the Kafka trigger.

compress.description: Compress determines whether to compress message or not. Defaults to false. If set to true, compresses message using snappy compression.

flushFrequency.description: FlushFrequency refers to the frequency in milliseconds to flush batches. Defaults to 500 milliseconds.

partitioningKey.description: The partitioning key for the messages put on the Kafka topic. Defaults to broker url.

requiredAcks.description: RequiredAcks used in producer to tell the broker how many replica acknowledgements Defaults to 1 (Only wait for the leader to ack).

tls.description: TLS configuration for the Kafka producer.

topic.description: Name of the topic. More info at https://kafka.apache.org/documentation/#intro_topics

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.Metadata.description: Metadata holds the annotations and labels of an event source pod

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.NATSTrigger.description: NATSTrigger refers to the specification of the NATS trigger.

subject.description: Name of the subject to put message on.

tls.description: TLS configuration for the NATS producer.

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.OpenWhiskTri.description: OpenWhiskTrigger refers to the specification of the OpenWhisk trigger.

namespace.description: Namespace for the action. Defaults to "_".

version.description: Version for the API. Defaults to v1.

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.Sensor.description: Sensor is the definition of a sensor resource

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.SensorList.description: SensorList is the list of Sensor resources

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

circuit.description: Circuit is a boolean expression of dependency groups

dependencies.description: Dependencies is a list of the events that this sensor is dependent on.

dependencyGroups.description: DependencyGroups is a list of the groups of events.

errorOnFailedRound.description: ErrorOnFailedRound if set to true, marks sensor state as `error` if the previous trigger round fails. Once sensor state is set to `error`, no further triggers will be processed.

eventBusName.description: EventBusName references to a EventBus name. By default the value is "default"

template.description: Template is the pod specification for the sensor

triggers.description: Triggers is a list of the things that this sensor evokes. These are the outputs from this sensor.

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.SensorStatus.description: SensorStatus contains information about the status of a sensor.

conditions.description: Conditions are the latest available observations of a resource's current state.

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.SlackTrigger.description: SlackTrigger refers to the specification of the slack notification trigger.

channel.description: Channel refers to which Slack channel to send slack message.

message.description: Message refers to the message to send to the Slack channel.

slackToken.description: SlackToken refers to the Kubernetes secret that holds the slack token required to send messages.

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.StandardK8ST.description: StandardK8STrigger is the standard Kubernetes resource trigger

liveObject.description: LiveObject specifies whether the resource should be directly fetched from K8s instead of being marshaled from the resource artifact. If set to true, the resource artifact must contain the information required to uniquely identify the resource in the cluster, that is, you must specify "apiVersion", "kind" as well as "name" and "namespace" meta data. Only valid for operation type `update`

operation.description: Operation refers to the type of operation performed on the k8s resource. Default value is Create.

patchStrategy.description: PatchStrategy controls the K8s object patching strategy when the trigger operation is specified as patch. possible values: "application/json-patch+json" "application/merge-patch+json" "application/strategic-merge-patch+json" "application/apply-patch+yaml". Defaults to "application/merge-patch+json"

source.description: Source of the K8 resource file(s)

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.StatusPolicy.description: StatusPolicy refers to the policy used to check the state of the trigger using response status

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.TLSConfig.description: TLSConfig refers to TLS configuration for the HTTP client

caCertPath.description: CACertPath refers the file path that contains the CA cert.

clientCertPath.description: ClientCertPath refers the file path that contains client cert.

clientKeyPath.description: ClientKeyPath refers the file path that contains client key.

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.Template.description: Template holds the information of a sensor deployment template

container.description: Container is the main container image to run in the gateway pod

metadata.description: Metdata sets the pods's metadata, i.e. annotations and labels

nodeSelector.description: NodeSelector is a selector which must be true for the pod to fit on a node. Selector which must match a node's labels for the pod to be scheduled on that node. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/assign-pod-node/

securityContext.description: SecurityContext holds pod-level security attributes and common container settings. Optional: Defaults to empty.  See type description for default values of each field.

serviceAccountName.description: ServiceAccountName is the name of the ServiceAccount to use to run gateway pod. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/configure-service-account/

volumes.description: Volumes is a list of volumes that can be mounted by containers in a workflow.

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.TimeFilter.description: TimeFilter describes a window in time. It filters out events that occur outside the time limits. In other words, only events that occur after Start and before Stop will pass this filter.

start.description: Start is the beginning of a time window in UTC. Before this time, events for this dependency are ignored. Format is hh:mm:ss.

stop.description: Stop is the end of a time window in UTC. After or equal to this time, events for this dependency are ignored and Format is hh:mm:ss. If it is smaller than Start, it is treated as next day of Start (e.g.: 22:00:00-01:00:00 means 22:00:00-25:00:00).

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.Trigger.description: Trigger is an action taken, output produced, an event created, a message sent

parameters.description: Parameters is the list of parameters applied to the trigger template definition

policy.description: Policy to configure backoff and execution criteria for the trigger

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.TriggerParam.description: TriggerParameter indicates a passed parameter to a service template

dest.description: Dest is the JSONPath of a resource key. A path is a series of keys separated by a dot. The colon character can be escaped with '.' The -1 key can be used to append a value to an existing array. See https://github.com/tidwall/sjson#path-syntax for more information about how this is used.

operation.description: Operation is what to do with the existing value at Dest, whether to 'prepend', 'overwrite', or 'append' it.

src.description: Src contains a source reference to the value of the parameter from a dependency

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.TriggerParam.description: TriggerParameterSource defines the source for a parameter from a event event

contextKey.description: ContextKey is the JSONPath of the event's (JSON decoded) context key ContextKey is a series of keys separated by a dot. A key may contain wildcard characters '*' and '?'. To access an array value use the index as the key. The dot and wildcard characters can be escaped with '\'. See https://github.com/tidwall/gjson#path-syntax for more information on how to use this.

contextTemplate.description: ContextTemplate is a go-template for extracting a string from the event's context. If a ContextTemplate is provided with a ContextKey, the template will be evaluated first and fallback to the ContextKey. The templating follows the standard go-template syntax as well as sprig's extra functions. See https://pkg.go.dev/text/template and https://masterminds.github.io/sprig/

dataKey.description: DataKey is the JSONPath of the event's (JSON decoded) data key DataKey is a series of keys separated by a dot. A key may contain wildcard characters '*' and '?'. To access an array value use the index as the key. The dot and wildcard characters can be escaped with '\'. See https://github.com/tidwall/gjson#path-syntax for more information on how to use this.

dataTemplate.description: DataTemplate is a go-template for extracting a string from the event's data. If a DataTemplate is provided with a DataKey, the template will be evaluated first and fallback to the DataKey. The templating follows the standard go-template syntax as well as sprig's extra functions. See https://pkg.go.dev/text/template and https://masterminds.github.io/sprig/

dependencyName.description: DependencyName refers to the name of the dependency. The event which is stored for this dependency is used as payload for the parameterization. Make sure to refer to one of the dependencies you have defined under Dependencies list.

value.description: Value is the default literal value to use for this parameter source This is only used if the DataKey is invalid. If the DataKey is invalid and this is not defined, this param source will produce an error.

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.TriggerPolic.description: TriggerPolicy dictates the policy for the trigger retries

k8s.description: K8SResourcePolicy refers to the policy used to check the state of K8s based triggers using using labels

status.description: Status refers to the policy used to check the state of the trigger using response status

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.TriggerSwitc.description: TriggerSwitch describes condition which must be satisfied in order to execute a trigger. Depending upon condition type, status of dependency groups is used to evaluate the result.

all.description: All acts as a AND operator between dependencies

any.description: Any acts as a OR operator between dependencies

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.TriggerTempl.description: TriggerTemplate is the template that describes trigger specification.

argoWorkflow.description: ArgoWorkflow refers to the trigger that can perform various operations on an Argo workflow.

awsLambda.description: AWSLambda refers to the trigger designed to invoke AWS Lambda function with with on-the-fly constructable payload.

custom.description: CustomTrigger refers to the trigger designed to connect to a gRPC trigger server and execute a custom trigger.

http.description: HTTP refers to the trigger designed to dispatch a HTTP request with on-the-fly constructable payload.

k8s.description: StandardK8STrigger refers to the trigger designed to create or update a generic Kubernetes resource.

kafka.description: Kafka refers to the trigger designed to place messages on Kafka topic.

name.description: Name is a unique name of the action to take.

nats.description: NATS refers to the trigger designed to place message on NATS subject.

openWhisk.description: OpenWhisk refers to the trigger designed to invoke OpenWhisk action.

slack.description: Slack refers to the trigger designed to send slack notification message.

switch.description: Switch is the condition to execute the trigger.

io.argoproj.sensor.v1alpha1.URLArtifact.description: URLArtifact contains information about an artifact at an http endpoint.

verifyCert.description: VerifyCert decides whether the connection is secure or not
